title: An Aggressive Supreme Court Reshapes the US as Its Standing Erodes
description: A conservative supermajority is remaking US laws on the environment, health and firearms, even as public confidence declines and ethical questions grow

title: Pentagon Says a $6 Billion Accounting Error Allows More Arms for Ukraine
description: The Pentagon said it will be able to spend $6 billion more than originally expected on arms for Ukraine thanks to what it called accounting errors.

title: UK to Guarantee $3 Billion of Loans to Aid Ukraine’s Recovery
description: The UK will guarantee $3 billion of World Bank loans to Ukraine over three years to bolster its economic stability in the face of Russian aggression, Rishi Sunak’s government said as it prepares to host a two-day recovery conference in London.

title: Biden Says He’s ‘Very Proud’ of Son Hunter After Plea Deal
description: President Joe Biden said he was proud of his son Hunter, who is entering into a deal with federal prosecutors on tax and firearms-related charges.

title: AI Critics, Advocates Vie for Influence as Regulations Take Shape
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, national security reporter Anna Edgerton outlines the competing influences on rules for artificial intelligence. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: IMF Urges Canada to Bring Back Debt Anchor and Keep Fiscal Policy Tight
description: The International Monetary Fund says Canada’s government should consider bringing back a debt anchor.

title: Australia Pressured to Use Russia War Windfall to Help Ukraine
description: “Aussies know a road warrior when they see one,” Ukraine’s Defense Department said earlier this month in a video posted to social media urging Australia to send over more tanks.

title: Biden Backs Effort to Crack Down on Cable and Satellite ‘Junk Fees’
description: US President Joe Biden voiced support for regulations that would require cable and satellite TV providers to give consumers an all-in price for video service rather than laying on hidden “junk” fees.

title: Lockheed Is Paying Millions for Overruns on Pentagon’s Missile Defense Radar
description: Lockheed Martin Corp. is absorbing millions of dollars in cost overruns on the Pentagon’s new land-based radar for detecting incoming ballistic missiles.

title: Bernie Sanders Launches Senate Probe Into Amazon Workplace Safety
description: Progressive Senator Bernie Sanders launched an investigation into charges of unsafe working conditions at Amazon.com Inc. warehouses across the US, raising the possibility of high-profile hearings on complaints over the retailer’s treatment of employees.

title: Pakistani Court Issues Arrest Warrant for Ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan
description: A Pakistani anti-terrorist court approved non-bailable arrest warrants for former prime minister Imran Khan and some of his aides linked to last month’s violence.

title: Retired NYPD Sergeant, Two Others Convicted of Acting as Agents of China
description: A retired New York City police sergeant and two others were convicted of acting as agents of the People’s Republic of China as well as on interstate stalking charges.

title: Meloni Sets Foot in the Elysee to Settle Tensions With France
description: Giorgia Meloni and Emmanuel Macron are finally ready to make peace.

title: Finance Chief Sees Peru’s Economic Growth Rebounding From Shocks
description: Peru Finance Minister Alex Contreras

title: EU’s Vestager Is Candidate to Run European Investment Bank
description: Margrethe Vestager, competition commissioner of the European Commission, speaks during an interview in her office in Brussels, Belgium, on Tuesday, Feb. 25, 2020. The European Union’s review of Google’s plan to buy Fitbit Inc. won’t involve privacy regulators, the bloc’s antitrust chief insisted, days after data watchdogs warned about how tech giants could use M&A to access citizens’ private information.

title: ECB Rate Hike in September Wouldn’t Be a Surprise, Simkus Says
description: The European Central Bank (ECB) headquarters ahead of a rates decision news conference in Frankfurt, Germany, on Thursday, June 15, 2023. European stocks dropped after Federal Reserve officials signaled interest rates will go higher than previously expected, while investors await the European Central Bank decision later on Thursday. Photographer: Alex Kraus/Bloomberg

title: Four Dead in West Bank Shooting, Emergency Services Say
description: Four people were killed in a West Bank shooting at a gas station outside a Jewish settlement, emergency services said.

title: Hunter Biden Reaches Deal on Federal Tax Crimes, Weapons Offense
description: Hunter Biden has agreed to plead guilty to two federal tax crimes, according to the US Attorney’s office in Delaware.

title: Hunter Biden Charged With Federal Tax, Weapons Offenses
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden’s son Hunter has been charged with failing to pay federal income tax and illegally possessing a weapon and has reached an agreement with the Justice Department, according to a letter filed in U.S. District Court in Delaware.

title: German, Chinese Premiers Tentatively Agree to Deeper Cooperation
description: Germany and China tentatively agreed to bind their economies more closely together and join forces to tackle climate change, even as Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s ruling coalition increasingly views the government in Beijing as a rival rather than partner.

title: Hounded by Opposition, Slovakia’s President Won’t Run Again
description: Slovakia’s president, who has faced years of attacks by the opposition for her commitment to transatlantic ties and support for Ukraine, said she won’t seek re-election in 2024.

title: Modi Looks to Solidify India’s Tech Prowess With US State Visit
description: Narendra Modi arrives in the US on his first official state visit with India’s geopolitical clout higher than at any point since he took power in 2014. He’ll be looking to leverage that to become an indispensable partner for American tech ambitions.

title: Ex-UK Chancellor Osborne Denies Austerity Hit Covid-19 Planning
description: Austerity imposed by the Conservative-led government after the financial crisis helped the UK’s pandemic preparedness, former Chancellor of the Exchequer George Osborne told the official Covid-19 inquiry, denying that budget cuts had left public services stretched and unable to cope.

title: Trump Faces Aug. 14 Trial Date in DOJ Classified Documents Case
description: The US judge who’s presiding over Donald Trump’s alleged mishandling of classified documents has set an Aug. 14, 2023 trial date.

title: Australians’ Views on China Improve as Ties Thaw, Poll Shows
description: Australians support a resumption of dialogue with Beijing and are shifting back toward viewing China as more of an economic partner than a security threat, a new survey showed, after relations collapsed in 2020.

title: Sunak Faces Cabinet Criticism Over Post-Brexit EU Borders Deal
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak faces criticism from within his own Cabinet over plans to pay the European Union for access to its Frontex border agency that would be limited by Britain’s post-Brexit status.

title: Musk Meeting on Modi’s US Agenda as India Seeks Tesla Factory
description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi will likely meet Elon Musk today on a visit to the US as the country woos Tesla Inc. to make electric cars locally, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: New EU Toolkit Has China in Its Sights. Now Comes the Hard Bit
description: The European Union and its member states are taking bolder steps to boost national security tools and shore up supplies, edging closer to the US strategy of avoiding over-dependence on China and curtailing the advance of its military capabilities.

title: Bank Mergers Face Fresh Antitrust Heat at US Justice Department
description: Top Justice Department antitrust lawyers are weighing a major revamp of how they scrutinize bank mergers, complicating further consolidation for an industry that’s facing some of its biggest challenges since the financial crisis.

title: Germany to Place Rheinmetall Ammunition Order Worth $130 Million
description: Germany is poised to place its latest major order with a domestic defense manufacturer in a push to replace depleted stocks of ammunition for rapid-fire howitzers supplied to Ukraine.

title: Europe Faces a High-Wire Act Over Security
description: The European Union seems agreed on the need to strengthen oversight on critical technologies, edging closer to the US strategy of avoiding an over-dependence on China and curtailing the advance of Beijing’s military capabilities.

title: PBOC Chief Vows to Curb Corruption After Ex-Official’s Arrest
description: A top Chinese central bank official called for persistent efforts to tackle corruption and better training for younger staff after a former deputy governor was arrested on suspicion of bribery.

title: Trucks Blocked at Balkan Border as Serbia-Kosovo Spat Escalates
description: Haulage trucks stand in a queue whilst waiting to cross the border into Serbia in Roszke, Hungary, on Wednesday, April 8, 2020. Across the globe, truckers are encountering delays along distribution chains snarled by the coronavirus pandemic. Photographer: Akos Stiller/Bloomberg

title: House Defense Spending Panel Slashes $20 Billion, Boosts F-35s
description: A US House panel, seeking to advance competing priorities while adhering to spending caps under debt-limit law, wants to prevent two amphibious assault ships from being retired and boost the Air Force’s F-35 Joint Strike Fighter fleet.

title: Egypt Hikes Private-Sector Wages Again After Pound Devaluations
description: Egypt hiked the minimum wage for private-sector workers for the second time in six months, as a series of dramatic currency devaluations leaves tens of millions of people struggling with soaring living costs.

title: States Are Rushing to Regulate Deepfakes as AI Goes Mainstream
description: Images of former President Donald Trump hugging and kissing Dr. Anthony Fauci, his ex-chief medical adviser. Pornographic depictions of Hollywood actresses and internet influencers. A photo of an explosion at the Pentagon.

title: Russian Oil Flows Edge Lower But Evidence of Cuts Remains Scant
description: Seaborne crude exports are still well above levels seen in February, the baseline month for cuts

title: Biden to Meet AI Experts as He Pushes for Privacy Safeguards
description: President Joe Biden is scheduled to meet with business leaders and experts on artificial intelligence as his administration pushes companies to develop new security and privacy safeguards.

title: Finland’s New Premier Wins Approval to Head Right-Wing Coalition
description: Petteri Orpo was approved by the Finnish parliament as the head of the new ruling coalition that has set out to fix the Nordic country’s deteriorating public finances and boost growth.

title: Turkey Raises Minimum Wage by 34% in Second Hike in a Year
description: Turkey raised the minimum wage for a second time this year, adding to inflationary pressures that could make the country’s new economic team’s job harder.

title: How Many People Does It Take for the Government to Send a Text?
description: Code for America is working to make it easier for welfare recipients to access benefits. The problem: Governments design it to be hard.

title: Ukraine Recap: Zelenskiy Says Most Potent Forces Holding Back
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Ukraine hasn’t yet used new assault brigades in its counteroffensive as troops advance across some parts of the front line.

title: UN Experts Warn of Deteriorating Security in Eastern Congo
description: Surging violence in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo and ongoing tensions with neighboring Rwanda could further destabilize the resource-rich country as it prepares for elections in December, a United Nations group of experts said.

title: Israeli Troops Kill a Palestinian Man in Renewed Clashes in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli forces killed a Palestinian man in fighting in the occupied West Bank, Palestinian officials said as the death toll from clashes earlier in the city of Jenin rose to six. The fatalities were the latest in a surge of violence that has wracked the region.

title: China, Cuba in Talks on Opening Military Training Site, WSJ Says
description: China and Cuba are discussing building a joint military training facility on the island, according to the Wall Street Journal, a report that comes after the White House earlier said Beijing has spy facilities on the island about 145 km (90 miles) from the US.

title: Australia Cautious on Chinese Investment in Vital Lithium Sector
description: Chinese investment in Australia’s minerals sector must be considered “strategically” as the countries compete directly in lithium refining, said Resources Minister Madeleine King.

title: India's Modi Taps Yoga to Flex Soft Power on World Stage
description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India’s prime minister has a reputation of casting himself as an ascetic. So when Narendra Modi leads foreign dignitaries and bureaucrats in a session for International Yoga Day on Wednesday at the United Nations’ Secretariat in New York, millions of Indians will take note.

title: Biden Says His Foreign Policy Knowledge Equals Even Kissinger
description: President Joe Biden praised his own experience in foreign policy on Monday, saying it was the equal of anyone — including veteran diplomat Henry Kissinger.

title: Trump Says He Kept Documents Because He Was ‘Very Busy’
description: Former President Donald Trump said he did not turn over presidential records to the National Archives because he was busy and had not yet had time to remove personal items from boxes packed at the White House.

title: Mexico’s Adan Lopez Declines Ruling Party Campaign Funds
description: Mexico’s former Interior Minister Adan Augusto Lopez declined to use the five million pesos ($292,000) offered by the Morena ruling party to those vying for the presidential nomination as they launch their campaigns this week.

title: Blinken’s China Trip Achieves Best Possible Outcome: More Talks
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken got a muted reception when he arrived in Beijing: a lone Foreign Ministry official there to meet him and no red carpet, just red lines on the runway that social media users joked were a symbol of China’s unwillingness to compromise on issues like Taiwan.

title: EU Readies €50 Billion Ukraine Package Ahead of Donor Summit
description: The European Union is ready to propose a financial aid package of around €50 billion ($55 billion) to support Ukraine as the country embarks on a critical counteroffensive to retake territory lost since Russia’s invasion more than a year ago.
